body_html:
To aselle:
Just a Raspberry Pi problem. Interpreter works like a charm on x86_64 ubuntu. Raspberry Pi throws out an error. My python2 is broken on my Raspberry Pi at the moment, but trying the 2.7 build worked for someone else.
::Edit::
I must have misunderstood. The 2.7 build doesn't work either.
::Edit End::
::Edit2::
Ok, it's the ARMv7 implementations that are interfering with the interpreter. Everything works peachy on the ci.tensorflow.org pi-zero binary. Follow the comments below to kind of follow along.
::End Edit2::
To those looking for a python3 workaround:
If you really want python3 to work, thortex's fix seems to be working, but I've been running his script for 12 hrs now. Furthermore, you need a usb drive as additional swap space. https://github.com/thortex/rpi3-tensorflow

body:
To aselle:
Just a Raspberry Pi problem.  Interpreter works like a charm on x86_64 ubuntu.  Raspberry Pi throws out an error.  My python2 is broken on my Raspberry Pi at the moment, but trying the 2.7 build worked for someone else.  
::Edit::
I must have misunderstood.  The 2.7 build doesn't work either.
::Edit End::
::Edit2::
Ok, it's the ARMv7 implementations that are interfering with the interpreter.  Everything works peachy on the ci.tensorflow.org pi-zero binary.  Follow the comments below to kind of follow along.
::End Edit2::
To those looking for a python3 workaround:
If you really want python3 to work, thortex's fix seems to be working, but I've been running his script for 12 hrs now.  Furthermore, you need a usb drive as additional swap space.  https://github.com/thortex/rpi3-tensorflow
